messages.content: Yep it sure kindles.
ocean will mald
this does do what it sets out to do
behold
~~a man~~
48 damage card in the base kit (but only against bosses really)
I like this card.

It's very versatile, and becomes really good in the late game, at which point the upgrade becomes worth it, because +1 strength means a lot more in the late game especially when backed by block and soulburn from radiant flame and volcano visage respectively
this is one of my favorite cards on hexaghost because it doesn't show its true power for most of the run
and before that, it does its job of igniting the bolster flame
one of the three cards that lets you renewably ignite the bolster flame, kindle, catch up, and forked flame
and again!, but again doesn't let you advance at the end of your turn, so it doesn't really count

this card also introduces the mechanic of double ignition to the player, at first by the upgrade making it obvious that you can ignite an already ignited ghostflame, and later through player discover with haunting echo and this card
and once you do, it becomes a 12 damage card (ish)

and then it hits you, and you realize that you can ignite the inferno ghostflame twice for 48 damage with just the base kit, meaning the way you go about taking cards for your first boss will change a lot

the concepts are hard to grapple with for most people at first, when I see people play hexaghost for the first time a lot of this goes over their head but I think it works out in the end because a lot of the stuff is intuitive at the end of the day
my first campfire upgrade
why is the upgrade so important
so you can trigger a flame twice early
oh god
it's the blood feud again

maybe people just don't like reading, idk, hexaghost is an extremely thinky character by just main mechanics, and some people see a certain card and refuse to interface with anything else or even with the character at all, or some people just don't understand how the character works, but it does really work, my favorite modded character honestly

also i find it silly that when you play this as the 2nd skill on the skill ghostflame it triggers twice

although slime boss is worse off in the art department
ghostflame supremacy is absolute
and thus kindle is the best card

ghostflames are fun
kindle doesn't really need the upgrade for a while at least, I like the upgrade a lot, but it's not completely necesary because you can still double ignite without it
there's a good reason why I made the Mistakes of the Past card art

yeah
it's a good fourth or fifth upgrade

there is a fast forward, it advances, so a card that retracts must also exist
because you can go backwards
it's either that or remove retract entirely which I don't think is good because even though retract is bad, you can still float+ backwards onto the bolster which has late game use

messages.content: big fan of this myself, and it's typically an early upgrade for me so I can double-dip
Wow it seems like blue guy and I never seem to agree. I think this is the worse hexa starter.
just because it's not a good floor 0 upgrade doesn't mean its not good
being one of the three cards that ignite the bolster while allowing you to continue
you might see this card and think "wow this is dog water it only deals 4 damage"
i am
but it's normally dealing 12
a sear upgrade enjoyer
i used to value float upgrade more
sear is a good upgrade for lagavulin and nob
but i realized actually i don't care about retract
especially lagavulin
so it's just stay on x ghostflame
and first upgrade should be early game focused
kindle upgrade is not early game focused at all
yeah kindle upgrade's main value comes from cards you don't have yet
intensity, radiant, and volcano yeah
I just value other ignite cards more than kindle personally
and I value other gf over sear, but it gets me through early game so I like it more
it's renewable
~~and ocean values strikes/defends~~
ocean is just bming hexaghost
and sear isn't meant to be a "good ghostflame"
it benefits the least from intensity, but the entire point of it is to keep soulburn up
if you look at the ghostflame wheel, the first and fourth are searing ghostflames
this means that if you're igniting your current ghostflame every turn, soulburn will always be up, so cards that inflict soulburn are rarely wasted except in cases of overkill damage
but soulburn is not "real" damage, but damage meant to lower the required amount of real damage needed on turn 3 in most fights
Sorry I meant soulburn, I was on the run while typing
sear is there, it's free, its a +4 damage upgrade, downfall starts with a rest site on floor zero

As a starter card, it primarily functions to let you keep moving around the ghostflames when you draw poorly, and especially to help trigger bolstering when you have no or few powers in your deck. It is a very low impact card most of the time during the early game, and is also a skill against gremlin nob, so it tends to perform poorly until you start to really get some things that care about igniting ghostflames (visage, radiant flame, sources of intensity). It tends to do quite well in the late game, but it needs to be carried in the early game, which is very easy for hexaghost to do with their powerful afterlife cards and shield/sword of night. That's a strange spot for a starter card to be in, as they usually should help smooth out your early game, but sear is an excellent early game starter card, and spirit brand also is amazing at that stage. Double ignition is pretty cool, and this card does show how to do that through its upgrade, but I do think it could be a little smoother/more intuitive in teaching that concept to newer players.

Very good if you can grab runic pyramid to let it smooth out moving around the circle even more, and to let you use it on the bolstering flame more often. Upgrade reads very strangely (as does the base card in relation to it), but is quite powerful in the late game as a way to enhance synergies with igniting ghostflames and moving around the wheel. I personally think sear is usually the correct upgrade at the first campfire, and I would only be looking to upgrade kindle if I had lots of the above mentioned synergies, usually no earlier than late act 2.

I'm still a fan of just recalling at the first fire as hexaghost. Recalling gives you 1 strength for the act 1 boss (most of the time) and saves a campfire later in the run. Kindle's upgrade does not help much when you only have your starter deck and even later on I would rather pick an upgrade on another card (or just let 5th seal upgrade my whole deck).
+4 damage for free against nob and +8 damage against lagavulin is suddenly bad now
nob and lagavulin are not scary I'm only concerned about sentries and sear is useless ageist them.
extra damage against nob is important since it lowers the turn 3 threshold which is the entire point of the nob matchup
and +8 damage against lagavulin can't be ignored, that's a ton of damage
